metadata.value: Mukhtasar Kitab al-Hisnul-Hasin and Surahs from the Koran
metadata.label: Alternate Title

metadata.value: View of bindings from two Islamic manuscripts. The larger of the two manuscripts, Or.Ms 153 is an incomplete collection of Surahs (Chapters) from the Qur'an, including numbers 1, 6, 36, 44, 48, 55, 56, 67 and 78-114. It is written in the Naskh script and also comprises of quotations in Turkish from a 13th century commentary on the Qur'an, as well as prayers and notes on the stature of the prophet. It is 6x4'' in size, with gold lined pages and is bound in gilt-stamped leather. It is not dated. Or.Ms 172 is a copy of the Mukhtasar Kitab al-Hisnul-Hasin. Measuring 3 inches by 1 7/8 inches, it is an abridgement of the Islamic devotional work, the Kitab al-Hisnul-Hasin, which was written by the celebrated theologian Muhammad al-Jazri (1350-1429CE). It adheres to the tenets of the Sunni branch of Islam. It is written in the Naskh script, with gilt-lined pages, and is bound in gilt-stamped leather. It is not dated. Sources: Hukk, M (1925), A descriptive catalogue of the Arabic and Persian manuscripts in Edinburgh University Library, Hertford. http://www.fordham.edu/halsall/source/Qur'an-sel.asp (accessed 01/07/14).
